label: 丈六
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Sixteen feet (i.e. about 4.8 meters) referred to the full length of a figure [buddha images]from head to foot, rather than to its height as actually posed.  In the case of a seated image (the usual pose), the actual height  was about 2.7 meters (p. 500n).
